definitions.definition: a set of tools or equipment that you use for a particular purpose

examples.text: Check the acidity of the soil with a test kit.
She keeps an emergency medical kit in her car.
There should be a needle and thread in the sewing kit.

definitions.definition: a set of parts ready to be made into something

examples.text: a kit for a model plane
She built the doll’s house from a kit.
The kit contains everything you need to make six candles.
The shed comes in kit form.

definitions.definition: a set of clothes and equipment that you use for a particular activity

examples.text: The soldiers packed tents and kits to move to new positions.
They left most of their kit at the camp.
the official supplier of the England team kit
a teddy bear dressed in a replica Real Madrid kit
I spent Sunday assembling emergency kits for the expedition.
I had new clothes, a new hairstyle—the whole caboodle.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Middle Dutch kitte ‘wooden vessel’, of unknown origin. The original sense ‘wooden tub’ was later applied to other containers; the use denoting a soldier's equipment (late 18th cent.) probably arose from the idea of a set of articles packed in a container.
